subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and Ant: stack trace filtering
msgSnippet: --On Thursday, December 06, 2001 09:20:25 +0100 Stefan Bodewig ... When I tried it the other day it only mentioned Testcase, at least, I think so.  I ll have
messageBody:
--On Thursday, December 06, 2001 09:20:25 +0100 Stefan Bodewig
<bodewig@...> wrote:

>> 100 tests run, 2 failed:
>> TestCase.testThisFailed
>> TestCase.testThisAlsoFailed
>
> But this is what the plain formatter will do (well, in a different
> format), something like
>
> Testcase: testThisFailed FAILED
> stacktrace here ...

When I tried it the other day it only mentioned Testcase, at least, I think
so. I'll have to check when I'm at work tomorrow.
